question: A block of certain mass is placed on a rough inclined plane. The angle between the plane and the horizontal is <katex>$30^{\circ}$</katex>. The coefficients of static and kinetic frictions between the block and the inclined plane are 0.6 and 0.5 respectively. Then the magnitude of the acceleration of the block is [Take <katex>$g=10 \text{ ms}^{-2}$</katex>]
explanation: Check if block slides. Downward force <katex>$mg \sin(30) = 0.5 mg$</katex>.
Max static friction <katex>$f_s = \mu_s mg \cos(30) = 0.6 \times mg \times 0.866 = 0.5196 mg$</katex>.
Since <katex>$mg \sin \theta < f_{s(max)}$</katex> (<katex>$0.5 < 0.5196$</katex>), the block does not move.
